body:
I originally advocated for throwing errors, as a way of not trusting actions to do the right thing, and centralizing the checking of durability. Now that I've seen it in action a bit, I think that wasn't the right decision.

I think adding `isDurable` as a storage method and removing the non-durable throw makes sense. 👍
